docs.lead_paragraph: SOME day, perhaps, A.E. Coppard will wake up to find himself famous--or at any rate, far better more than he is today. In each generation there are a few, a very few, in whom there lies the gift of telling delightful tales, and in this generation there is pre-eminently Coppard.

headline.main: "Silver Circus" and Other Recent Works of Fiction; CARLYLE'S WIFE GIVES THE DOCTORS A PIECE OF HER MIND Latest Works of Fiction TWO WOMEN A HAUNTING NOVEL Latest Works of Fiction COTTON PATCH NEGROES
